com.revolsys.io

Interface Reader<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the item to read.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Iterable<T>, ObjectWithProperties
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RecordReader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDirectoryReader, AbstractMultipleIteratorReader, AbstractReader, DelegatingReader, FileGdbReader, FilterReader, GeometryReader, IteratorReader, JsonMapReader, ListReader, ListRecordReader, MapReaderRecordReader, MoepBinaryReader, MoepDirectoryReader, RecordDefinitionConvertRecordReader, RecordDirectoryReader, RecordIteratorReader, RecordStoreQueryReader, SaifReader, ShapefileDirectoryReader, XbaseDatasetReader, ZipRecordReader

    public interface Reader<T>
extends Iterable<T>, ObjectWithProperties, AutoCloseable

    The Reader interface defines methods for reading objects of type T. Objects can either by read as a List or using an Iterator or visited using a Visitor.

    The simplest and most effecient way to loop through all objects in the reader is to use the following loop. 

     Reader<T> reader = ...
 for (T object : reader) {
   // Do something with the object.
 }
    Author:
    Paul Austin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the reader and all resources associated with it.
      Iterator<T> iterator()
      Return a new iterator for type T at the first item to read.
      void open()
      Open the reader so that it is ready to be read from.
      List<T> read()
      Read all items and return a List containing the items.
      void visit(Visitor<T> visitor)
      Visit each item returned from the reader until all items have been visited or the visit method returns false.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.revolsys.io.ObjectWithProperties

        clearProperties, getProperties, getProperty, getProperty, removeProperty, setProperties, setProperty, setPropertySoft, setPropertyWeak

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
           throws RuntimeException
        Close the reader and all resources associated with it.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        RuntimeException

      • iterator

        Iterator<T> iterator()
        Return a new iterator for type T at the first item to read. Subsequent calls to this method must return a new iterator. Implementors of this are responsible for cleaning up the iterator when the hasNext or next method on iterator reaches the end of the items to read.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<T>
        Returns:
        The iterator.

      • open

        void open()
        Open the reader so that it is ready to be read from.

      • read

        List<T> read()
        Read all items and return a List containing the items.
        Returns:
        The list of items.

      • visit

        void visit(Visitor<T> visitor)
        Visit each item returned from the reader until all items have been visited or the visit method returns false.
        Parameters:
        visitor - The visitor.
